comments.content: Well, "aurea ultraitalic" is a [Googlewhack](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121902/http:/www.google.com/search?q=aurea%2Bultraitalic&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8) (at least until the Googlebots find this page), not to mention a [T-26 font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121902/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/aurea-ultra/).

No so fast Mark!   
"Ultraitalic" or "ultraltalic" aren't in the officially sanctioned Googlewhack [dictionary](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121902/http:/dictionary.reference.com/).   
Googlewhacking is an exact science. You can't mess around with the [rules](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121902/http:/www.googlewhack.com/rules.htm) :-)
